Platform
The built-in function 'input' is used which, in Python 2, can allow arbitrary code to be run.

shortDescription.text: Binding a socket to all network interfaces

fullDescription.text: Binding a socket to all interfaces opens it up to traffic from any IPv4 address and is therefore associated with security risks.

properties.description:
Binding a socket to all interfaces opens it up to traffic from any IPv4 address
 and is therefore associated with security risks.
properties.name: Binding a socket to all network interfaces

shortDescription.text: Construction of a cookie using user-supplied input

fullDescription.text: Constructing cookies from user input may allow an attacker to perform a Cookie Poisoning attack.

properties.description: Constructing cookies from user input may allow an attacker to perform a Cookie Poisoning attack.
properties.name: Construction of a cookie using user-supplied input

fullDescription.text: Matching a URL or hostname against a regular expression that contains an unescaped dot as part of the hostname might match more hostnames than expected.

properties.description: Matching a URL or hostname against a regular expression that contains an unescaped dot as part of the hostname might match more hostnames than expected.
properties.name: Incomplete regular expression for hostnames

fullDescription.text: Security checks on the substrings of an unparsed URL are often vulnerable to bypassing.

properties.description: Security checks on the substrings of an unparsed URL are often vulnerable to bypassing.
properties.name: Incomplete URL substring sanitization

fullDescription.text: Overly permissive regular expression ranges match a wider range of characters than intended. This may allow an attacker to bypass a filter or sanitizer.

properties.description:
Overly permissive regular expression ranges match a wider range of characters than intended.
              This may allow an attacker to bypass a filter or sanitizer.
properties.name: Overly permissive regular expression range

shortDescription.text: Uncontrolled data used in path expression

fullDescription.text: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.

properties.description: Accessing paths influenced by users can allow an attacker to access unexpected resources.
properties.name: Uncontrolled data used in path expression

fullDescription.text: Using user-controlled data to create a template can lead to remote code execution or cross site scripting.

properties.description: Using user-controlled data to create a template can lead to remote code execution or cross site scripting.
properties.name: Server Side Template Injection

fullDescription.text: Using externally controlled strings in a command line may allow a malicious user to change the meaning of the command.

properties.description:
Using externally controlled strings in a command line may allow a malicious

properties.name: Uncontrolled command line

fullDescription.text: Writing user input directly to a web page allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.

properties.description:
Writing user input directly to a web page
              allows for a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
properties.name: Reflected server-side cross-site scripting

shortDescription.text: SQL query built from user-controlled sources

fullDescription.text: Building a SQL query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of malicious SQL code by the user.

properties.description:
Building a SQL query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of
              malicious SQL code by the user.
properties.name: SQL query built from user-controlled sources

properties.description:
Building an LDAP query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of

properties.name: LDAP query built from user-controlled sources

fullDescription.text: Interpreting unsanitized user input as code allows a malicious user to perform arbitrary code execution.

properties.description:
Interpreting unsanitized user input as code allows a malicious user to perform arbitrary

properties.name: Code injection

fullDescription.text: Writing user input directly to an HTTP header makes code vulnerable to attack by header splitting.

properties.description:
Writing user input directly to an HTTP header
              makes code vulnerable to attack by header splitting.
properties.name: HTTP Response Splitting

fullDescription.text: Matching HTML tags using regular expressions is hard to do right, and can easily lead to security issues.

properties.description: Matching HTML tags using regular expressions is hard to do right, and can easily lead to security issues.
properties.name: Bad HTML filtering regexp

fullDescription.text: Leaking information about an exception, such as messages and stack traces, to an external user can expose implementation details that are useful to an attacker for developing a subsequent exploit.

properties.description:
Leaking information about an exception, such as messages and stack traces, to an

              developing a subsequent exploit.
properties.name: Information exposure through an exception

properties.description: Running a Flask app in debug mode may allow an attacker to run arbitrary code through the Werkzeug debugger.
properties.name: Flask app is run in debug mode

Leaving the SSL/TLS version unspecified may result in an insecure

properties.name: Use of a broken or weak cryptographic hashing algorithm on sensitive data

Disabling or weakening CSRF protection may make the application

properties.description: Deserializing user-controlled data may allow attackers to execute arbitrary code.

URL redirection based on unvalidated user input

Parsing user input as an XML document with external

Insecure cookies may be sent in cleartext, which makes them vulnerable to

properties.description:
Building a XPath query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of

properties.name: XPath query built from user-controlled sources

shortDescription.text: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data

fullDescription.text: A regular expression that can require polynomial time to match may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

properties.description:
A regular expression that can require polynomial time
              to match may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.
properties.name: Polynomial regular expression used on uncontrolled data

fullDescription.text: A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

properties.description:
A regular expression that requires exponential time to match certain inputs
              can be a performance bottleneck, and may be vulnerable to denial-of-service
              attacks.
properties.name: Inefficient regular expression

User input should not be used in regular expressions without first being escaped,
              otherwise a malicious user may be able to inject an expression that could require
              exponential time on certain inputs.
properties.name: Regular expression injection

fullDescription.text: Parsing user input as an XML document with arbitrary internal entity expansion is vulnerable to denial-of-service attacks.

properties.description:
Parsing user input as an XML document with arbitrary internal

properties.description: Making a network request to a URL that is fully user-controlled allows for request forgery attacks.
properties.name: Full server-side request forgery

Building a NoSQL query from user-controlled sources is vulnerable to insertion of

properties.name: NoSQL Injection

fullDescription.text: Extracting files from a malicious tar archive without validating that the destination file path is within the destination directory can cause files outside the destination directory to be overwritten.

Extracting files from a malicious tar archive without validating that the
              destination file path is within the destination directory can cause files outside
              the destination directory to be overwritten.
properties.name: Arbitrary file write during tarfile extraction

Using externally controlled strings in a command line may allow a malicious

properties.name: Unsafe shell command constructed from library input

properties.description:
Using jinja2 templates with 'autoescape=False' can
              cause a cross-site scripting vulnerability.
properties.name: Jinja2 templating with autoescape=False

fullDescription.text: Building log entries from user-controlled data is vulnerable to insertion of forged log entries by a malicious user.

properties.description:
Building log entries from user-controlled data is vulnerable to
              insertion of forged log entries by a malicious user.
properties.name: Log Injection

fullDescription.text: Making a request without certificate validation can allow man-in-the-middle attacks.

properties.description: Making a request without certificate validation can allow man-in-the-middle attacks.
properties.name: Request without certificate validation

fullDescription.text: Allowing files to be readable or writable by users other than the owner may allow sensitive information to be accessed.

properties.description: Allowing files to be readable or writable by users other than the owner may allow sensitive information to be accessed.
properties.name: Overly permissive file permissions

fullDescription.text: Making a network request to a URL that is partially user-controlled allows for request forgery attacks.

properties.description: Making a network request to a URL that is partially user-controlled allows for request forgery attacks.
properties.name: Partial server-side request forgery

shortDescription.text: Total lines of Python code in the database

fullDescription.text: The total number of lines of Python code across all files, including external libraries and auto-generated files. This is a useful metric of the size of a database. This query counts the lines of code, excluding whitespace or comments.

properties.description:
The total number of lines of Python code across all files, including
   external libraries and auto-generated files. This is a useful metric of the size of a
   database. This query counts the lines of code, excluding whitespace or comments.
properties.name: Total lines of Python code in the database

shortDescription.text: Total lines of user written Python code in the database

fullDescription.text: The total number of lines of Python code from the source code directory, excluding auto-generated files. This query counts the lines of code, excluding whitespace or comments. Note: If external libraries are included in the codebase either in a checked-in virtual environment or as vendored code, that will currently be counted as user written code.

properties.description:
The total number of lines of Python code from the source code directory,
   excluding auto-generated files. This query counts the lines of code, excluding
   whitespace or comments. Note: If external libraries are included in the codebase
   either in a checked-in virtual environment or as vendored code, that will currently
   be counted as user written code.
properties.name: Total lines of user written Python code in the database

shortDescription.text: Missing call to superclass `__del__` during object destruction

fullDescription.text: An omitted call to a superclass `__del__` method may lead to class instances not being cleaned up properly.

properties.description: An omitted call to a superclass `__del__` method may lead to class instances not being cleaned up properly.
properties.name: Missing call to superclass `__del__` during object destruction

shortDescription.text: Missing call to superclass `__init__` during object initialization

fullDescription.text: An omitted call to a superclass `__init__` method may lead to objects of this class not being fully initialized.

properties.description: An omitted call to a superclass `__init__` method may lead to objects of this class not being fully initialized.
properties.name: Missing call to superclass `__init__` during object initialization

shortDescription.text: Multiple calls to `__del__` during object destruction

fullDescription.text: A duplicated call to a superclass `__del__` method may lead to class instances not be cleaned up properly.

properties.description: A duplicated call to a superclass `__del__` method may lead to class instances not be cleaned up properly.
properties.name: Multiple calls to `__del__` during object destruction

shortDescription.text: Multiple calls to `__init__` during object initialization

fullDescription.text: A duplicated call to a superclass `__init__` method may lead to objects of this class not being properly initialized.

properties.description: A duplicated call to a superclass `__init__` method may lead to objects of this class not being properly initialized.
properties.name: Multiple calls to `__init__` during object initialization

fullDescription.text: Defining a hash operation without defining equality may be a mistake.

properties.description: Defining a hash operation without defining equality may be a mistake.
properties.name: Inconsistent equality and hashing

fullDescription.text: Class definitions of equality and inequality operators may be inconsistent.

properties.description: Class definitions of equality and inequality operators may be inconsistent.
properties.name: Inconsistent equality and inequality

fullDescription.text: Class defines ordering comparison methods, but does not define both strict and nonstrict ordering methods, to ensure all four comparison operators behave as expected.

properties.description: Class defines ordering comparison methods, but does not define both strict and nonstrict ordering methods, to ensure all four comparison operators behave as expected.
properties.name: Incomplete ordering

fullDescription.text: When a class subclasses multiple base classes and more than one base class defines the same attribute, attribute overriding may result in unexpected behavior by instances of this class.

properties.description: When a class subclasses multiple base classes and more than one base class defines the same attribute, attribute overriding may result in unexpected behavior by instances of this class.
properties.name: Conflicting attributes in base classes

fullDescription.text: When adding new attributes to instances of a class, equality for that class needs to be defined.

properties.description: When adding new attributes to instances of a class, equality for that class needs to be defined.
properties.name: `__eq__` not overridden when adding attributes

fullDescription.text: Class definition will raise a type error at runtime due to inconsistent method resolution order(MRO)

properties.description: Class definition will raise a type error at runtime due to inconsistent method resolution order(MRO)
properties.name: Inconsistent method resolution order

fullDescription.text: Calling a method from `__init__` that is overridden by a subclass may result in a partially initialized instance being observed.

properties.description:
Calling a method from `__init__` that is overridden by a subclass may result in a partially
              initialized instance being observed.
properties.name: `__init__` method calls overridden method

shortDescription.text: Mutation of descriptor in `__get__` or `__set__` method.

fullDescription.text: Descriptor objects can be shared across many instances. Mutating them can cause strange side effects or race conditions.

properties.description: Descriptor objects can be shared across many instances. Mutating them can cause strange side effects or race conditions.
properties.name: Mutation of descriptor in `__get__` or `__set__` method.

shortDescription.text: Overwriting attribute in super-class or sub-class

fullDescription.text: Assignment to self attribute overwrites attribute previously defined in subclass or superclass `__init__` method.

properties.description: Assignment to self attribute overwrites attribute previously defined in subclass or superclass `__init__` method.
properties.name: Overwriting attribute in super-class or sub-class

fullDescription.text: Using property descriptors in old-style classes does not work from Python 2.1 onward.

properties.description: Using property descriptors in old-style classes does not work from Python 2.1 onward.
properties.name: Property in old-style class

fullDescription.text: Overriding the class dictionary by declaring `__slots__` is not supported by old-style classes.

properties.description:
Overriding the class dictionary by declaring `__slots__` is not supported by old-style
              classes.
properties.name: `__slots__` in old-style class

fullDescription.text: Defining an attribute in a superclass method with a name that matches a subclass method, hides the method in the subclass.

properties.description:
Defining an attribute in a superclass method with a name that matches a subclass
              method, hides the method in the subclass.
properties.name: Superclass attribute shadows subclass method

fullDescription.text: Using super() to access inherited methods is not supported by old-style classes.

properties.description: Using super() to access inherited methods is not supported by old-style classes.
properties.name: 'super' in old style class

shortDescription.text: Wrong name for an argument in a class instantiation

fullDescription.text: Using a named argument whose name does not correspond to a parameter of the __init__ method of the class being instantiated, will result in a TypeError at runtime.

properties.description:
Using a named argument whose name does not correspond to a
              parameter of the __init__ method of the class being
              instantiated, will result in a TypeError at runtime.
properties.name: Wrong name for an argument in a class instantiation

shortDescription.text: Wrong number of arguments in a class instantiation

fullDescription.text: Using too many or too few arguments in a call to the `__init__` method of a class will result in a TypeError at runtime.

properties.description:
Using too many or too few arguments in a call to the `__init__`
              method of a class will result in a TypeError at runtime.
properties.name: Wrong number of arguments in a class instantiation

fullDescription.text: Handling 'BaseException' means that system exits and keyboard interrupts may be mis-handled.

properties.description: Handling 'BaseException' means that system exits and keyboard interrupts may be mis-handled.
properties.name: Except block handles 'BaseException'

fullDescription.text: Except doesn't do anything and has no comment

properties.description: Except doesn't do anything and has no comment
properties.name: Empty except

fullDescription.text: An exception handler specifying a non-exception type will never handle any exception.

properties.description: An exception handler specifying a non-exception type will never handle any exception.
properties.name: Non-exception in 'except' clause

fullDescription.text: Raising a non-exception object or type will result in a TypeError being raised instead.

properties.description: Raising a non-exception object or type will result in a TypeError being raised instead.
properties.name: Illegal raise

fullDescription.text: Handling general exceptions before specific exceptions means that the specific handlers are never executed.

properties.description:
Handling general exceptions before specific exceptions means that the specific
              handlers are never executed.
properties.name: Unreachable `except` block

fullDescription.text: Using `NotImplemented` as an exception will result in a type error.

properties.description: Using `NotImplemented` as an exception will result in a type error.
properties.name: Raising `NotImplemented`

fullDescription.text: Raising a tuple will result in all but the first element being discarded

properties.description: Raising a tuple will result in all but the first element being discarded
properties.name: Raising a tuple

fullDescription.text: Calling next() in a generator may cause unintended early termination of an iteration.

properties.description: Calling next() in a generator may cause unintended early termination of an iteration.
properties.name: Unguarded next in generator

shortDescription.text: First argument to super() is not enclosing class

fullDescription.text: Calling super with something other than the enclosing class may cause incorrect object initialization.

properties.description: Calling super with something other than the enclosing class may cause incorrect object initialization.
properties.name: First argument to super() is not enclosing class

fullDescription.text: Comparison of constants is always constant, but is harder to read than a simple constant.

properties.description: Comparison of constants is always constant, but is harder to read than a simple constant.
properties.name: Comparison of constants

fullDescription.text: Comparison of identical values, the intent of which is unclear.

properties.description: Comparison of identical values, the intent of which is unclear.
properties.name: Comparison of identical values

fullDescription.text: Comparison of identical values, the intent of which is unclear.

properties.description: Comparison of identical values, the intent of which is unclear.
properties.name: Maybe missing 'self' in comparison

fullDescription.text: The result of a comparison is implied by a previous comparison.

properties.description: The result of a comparison is implied by a previous comparison.
properties.name: Redundant comparison

fullDescription.text: A membership test, such as 'item in sequence', with a non-container on the right hand side will raise a 'TypeError'.

properties.description: A membership test, such as 'item in sequence', with a non-container on the right hand side will raise a 'TypeError'.
properties.name: Membership test with a non-container

fullDescription.text: Duplicate key in dict literal. All but the last will be lost.

properties.description: Duplicate key in dict literal. All but the last will be lost.
properties.name: Duplicate key in dict literal

fullDescription.text: Testing whether an object is 'None' using the == operator is inefficient and potentially incorrect.

properties.description: Testing whether an object is 'None' using the == operator is inefficient and potentially incorrect.
properties.name: Testing equality to None

shortDescription.text: Formatted object is not a mapping

fullDescription.text: The formatted object must be a mapping when the format includes a named specifier; otherwise a TypeError will be raised."

properties.description: The formatted object must be a mapping when the format includes a named specifier; otherwise a TypeError will be raised."
properties.name: Formatted object is not a mapping

fullDescription.text: The `__del__` special method is called by the virtual machine when an object is being finalized. It should not be called explicitly.

properties.description: The `__del__` special method is called by the virtual machine when an object is being finalized. It should not be called explicitly.
properties.name: `__del__` is called explicitly

shortDescription.text: Formatting string mixes implicitly and explicitly numbered fields

fullDescription.text: Using implicit and explicit numbering in string formatting operations, such as '"{}: {1}".format(a,b)', will raise a ValueError.

properties.description: Using implicit and explicit numbering in string formatting operations, such as '"{}: {1}".format(a,b)', will raise a ValueError.
properties.name: Formatting string mixes implicitly and explicitly numbered fields

shortDescription.text: Unused argument in a formatting call

fullDescription.text: Including surplus arguments in a formatting call makes code more difficult to read and may indicate an error.

properties.description: Including surplus arguments in a formatting call makes code more difficult to read and may indicate an error.
properties.name: Unused argument in a formatting call

shortDescription.text: Unused named argument in formatting call

properties.description: Including surplus keyword arguments in a formatting call makes code more difficult to read and may indicate an error.
properties.name: Unused named argument in formatting call

properties.description:
A string formatting operation, such as '"{name}".format(key=b)',

properties.name: Missing named arguments in formatting call

A string formatting operation, such as '"{0}: {1}, {2}".format(a,b)',

properties.name: Unnecessary lambda

properties.name: Unsupported format character

shortDescription.text: Wrong name for an argument in a call

fullDescription.text: Using a named argument whose name does not correspond to a parameter of the called function or method, will result in a TypeError at runtime.

properties.description:
Using a named argument whose name does not correspond to a
              parameter of the called function or method, will result in a
              TypeError at runtime.
properties.name: Wrong name for an argument in a call

shortDescription.text: Wrong number of arguments for format

fullDescription.text: A string formatting operation, such as '"%s: %s, %s" % (a,b)', where the number of conversion specifiers in the format string differs from the number of values to be formatted will raise a TypeError.

properties.description:
A string formatting operation, such as '"%s: %s, %s" % (a,b)', where the number of conversion specifiers in the
              format string differs from the number of values to be formatted will raise a TypeError.
properties.name: Wrong number of arguments for format

shortDescription.text: Wrong number of arguments in a call

fullDescription.text: Using too many or too few arguments in a call to a function will result in a TypeError at runtime.

properties.description: Using too many or too few arguments in a call to a function will result in a TypeError at runtime.
properties.name: Wrong number of arguments in a call

shortDescription.text: Explicit returns mixed with implicit (fall through) returns

fullDescription.text: Mixing implicit and explicit returns indicates a likely error as implicit returns always return `None`.

properties.description: Mixing implicit and explicit returns indicates a likely error as implicit returns always return `None`.
properties.name: Explicit returns mixed with implicit (fall through) returns

fullDescription.text: Defining special methods for slicing has been deprecated since Python 2.0.

properties.description: Defining special methods for slicing has been deprecated since Python 2.0.
properties.name: Deprecated slice method

fullDescription.text: Explicitly returning a value from an `__init__` method will raise a TypeError.

properties.description: Explicitly returning a value from an `__init__` method will raise a TypeError.
properties.name: `__init__` method returns a value

shortDescription.text: Mismatch between signature and use of an overriding method

fullDescription.text: Method has a different signature from the overridden method and, if it were called, would be likely to cause an error.

properties.description: Method has a different signature from the overridden method and, if it were called, would be likely to cause an error.
properties.name: Mismatch between signature and use of an overriding method

shortDescription.text: Mismatch between signature and use of an overridden method

fullDescription.text: Method has a signature that differs from both the signature of its overriding methods and the arguments with which it is called, and if it were called, would be likely to cause an error.

properties.description:
Method has a signature that differs from both the signature of its overriding methods and
              the arguments with which it is called, and if it were called, would be likely to cause an error.
properties.name: Mismatch between signature and use of an overridden method

shortDescription.text: Non-standard exception raised in special method

fullDescription.text: Raising a non-standard exception in a special method alters the expected interface of that method.

properties.description: Raising a non-standard exception in a special method alters the expected interface of that method.
properties.name: Non-standard exception raised in special method

fullDescription.text: `__init__` method is a generator.

properties.description: `__init__` method is a generator.
properties.name: `__init__` method is a generator

fullDescription.text: The `__iter__` method returns a non-iterator which, if used in a 'for' loop, would raise a 'TypeError'.

properties.description: The `__iter__` method returns a non-iterator which, if used in a 'for' loop, would raise a 'TypeError'.
properties.name: `__iter__` method returns a non-iterator

shortDescription.text: Iterator does not return self from `__iter__` method

fullDescription.text: Iterator does not return self from `__iter__` method, violating the iterator protocol.

properties.description: Iterator does not return self from `__iter__` method, violating the iterator protocol.
properties.name: Iterator does not return self from `__iter__` method

fullDescription.text: Modifying the default value of a parameter can lead to unexpected results.

properties.description:
Modifying the default value of a parameter can lead to unexpected
              results.
properties.name: Modification of parameter with default

shortDescription.text: First parameter of a class method is not named 'cls'

fullDescription.text: By the PEP8 style guide, the first parameter of a class method should be named `cls`.

properties.description: By the PEP8 style guide, the first parameter of a class method should be named `cls`.
properties.name: First parameter of a class method is not named 'cls'

shortDescription.text: First parameter of a method is not named 'self'

fullDescription.text: By the PEP8 style guide, the first parameter of a normal method should be named `self`.

properties.description: By the PEP8 style guide, the first parameter of a normal method should be named `self`.
properties.name: First parameter of a method is not named 'self'

fullDescription.text: `__del__` methods may be called at arbitrary times, perhaps never called at all, and should be simple.

properties.description: `__del__` methods may be called at arbitrary times, perhaps never called at all, and should be simple.
properties.name: Overly complex `__del__` method

fullDescription.text: A function that potentially returns tuples of different lengths may indicate a problem.

properties.description: A function that potentially returns tuples of different lengths may indicate a problem.
properties.name: Returning tuples with varying lengths

fullDescription.text: Overriding a method without ensuring that both methods accept the same number and type of parameters has the potential to cause an error when there is a mismatch.

properties.description:
Overriding a method without ensuring that both methods accept the same
              number and type of parameters has the potential to cause an error when there is a mismatch.
properties.name: Signature mismatch in overriding method

fullDescription.text: Special method has incorrect signature

properties.description: Special method has incorrect signature
properties.name: Special method has incorrect signature

shortDescription.text: Use of the return value of a procedure

fullDescription.text: The return value of a procedure (a function that does not return a value) is used. This is confusing to the reader as the value (None) has no meaning.

properties.description: The return value of a procedure (a function that does not return a value) is used. This is confusing to the reader as the value (None) has no meaning.
properties.name: Use of the return value of a procedure

fullDescription.text: Module forms part of an import cycle, thereby indirectly importing itself.

properties.description: Module forms part of an import cycle, thereby indirectly importing itself.
properties.name: Cyclic import

fullDescription.text: Import of a deprecated module

properties.description: Import of a deprecated module
properties.name: Import of deprecated module

fullDescription.text: Encoding errors cause failures at runtime and prevent analysis of the code.

properties.description: Encoding errors cause failures at runtime and prevent analysis of the code.
properties.name: Encoding error

fullDescription.text: Importing the value of a mutable attribute directly means that changes in global state will not be observed locally.

properties.description: Importing the value of a mutable attribute directly means that changes in global state will not be observed locally.
properties.name: Importing value of mutable attribute

shortDescription.text: Module is imported with 'import' and 'import from'

fullDescription.text: A module is imported with the "import" and "import from" statements

properties.description: A module is imported with the "import" and "import from" statements
properties.name: Module is imported with 'import' and 'import from'

fullDescription.text: A module imports itself

properties.description: A module imports itself
properties.name: Module imports itself

fullDescription.text: Module uses member of cyclically imported module, which can lead to failure at import time.

properties.description: Module uses member of cyclically imported module, which can lead to failure at import time.
properties.name: Module-level cyclic import

shortDescription.text: Module is imported more than once

fullDescription.text: Importing a module a second time has no effect and impairs readability

properties.description: Importing a module a second time has no effect and impairs readability
properties.name: Module is imported more than once

fullDescription.text: Syntax errors cause failures at runtime and prevent analysis of the code.

properties.description: Syntax errors cause failures at runtime and prevent analysis of the code.
properties.name: Syntax error

fullDescription.text: Importing a module using 'import *' may unintentionally pollute the global namespace if the module does not define `__all__`

properties.description:
Importing a module using 'import *' may unintentionally pollute the global
              namespace if the module does not define `__all__`
properties.name: 'import *' may pollute namespace

fullDescription.text: Import is not required as it is not used

properties.description: Import is not required as it is not used
properties.name: Unused import

fullDescription.text: Commented-out code makes the remaining code more difficult to read.

properties.description: Commented-out code makes the remaining code more difficult to read.
properties.name: Commented-out code

fullDescription.text: Octal literal with a leading 0 is easily misread as a decimal value

properties.description: Octal literal with a leading 0 is easily misread as a decimal value
properties.name: Confusing octal literal

fullDescription.text: Calculating the length of the hypotenuse using the standard formula may lead to overflow.

properties.description: Calculating the length of the hypotenuse using the standard formula may lead to overflow.
properties.name: Pythagorean calculation with sub-optimal numerics

fullDescription.text: Opening a file without ensuring that it is always closed may lead to data loss or resource leaks.

properties.description: Opening a file without ensuring that it is always closed may lead to data loss or resource leaks.
properties.name: File is not always closed

fullDescription.text: Using an assert statement to test a tuple provides no validity checking.

properties.description: Using an assert statement to test a tuple provides no validity checking.
properties.name: Asserting a tuple

fullDescription.text: Using a Break or Return statement in a finally block causes the Try-finally block to exit, discarding the exception.

properties.description:
Using a Break or Return statement in a finally block causes the
              Try-finally block to exit, discarding the exception.
properties.name: 'break' or 'return' statement in finally

shortDescription.text: Constant in conditional expression or statement

fullDescription.text: The conditional is always true or always false

properties.description: The conditional is always true or always false
properties.name: Constant in conditional expression or statement

shortDescription.text: Iterable can be either a string or a sequence

fullDescription.text: Iteration over either a string or a sequence in the same loop can cause errors that are hard to find.

properties.description: Iteration over either a string or a sequence in the same loop can cause errors that are hard to find.
properties.name: Iterable can be either a string or a sequence

fullDescription.text: Assigning multiple variables without ensuring that you define a value for each variable causes an exception at runtime.

properties.description:
Assigning multiple variables without ensuring that you define a
              value for each variable causes an exception at runtime.
properties.name: Mismatch in multiple assignment

shortDescription.text: Modification of dictionary returned by locals()

fullDescription.text: Modifications of the dictionary returned by locals() are not propagated to the local variables of a function.

properties.description: Modifications of the dictionary returned by locals() are not propagated to the local variables of a function.
properties.name: Modification of dictionary returned by locals()

fullDescription.text: Nested loops in which the target variable is the same for each loop make the behavior of the loops difficult to understand.

properties.description:
Nested loops in which the target variable is the same for each loop make
              the behavior of the loops difficult to understand.
properties.name: Nested loops with same variable

shortDescription.text: Nested loops with same variable reused after inner loop body

fullDescription.text: Redefining a variable in an inner loop and then using the variable in an outer loop causes unexpected behavior.

properties.description:
Redefining a variable in an inner loop and then using
              the variable in an outer loop causes unexpected behavior.
properties.name: Nested loops with same variable reused after inner loop body

fullDescription.text: Using a non-iterable as the object in a 'for' loop causes a TypeError.

properties.description: Using a non-iterable as the object in a 'for' loop causes a TypeError.
properties.name: Non-iterable used in for loop

fullDescription.text: Assigning a variable to itself is useless and very likely indicates an error in the code.

properties.description: Assigning a variable to itself is useless and very likely indicates an error in the code.
properties.name: Redundant assignment

shortDescription.text: Use of 'return' or 'yield' outside a function

fullDescription.text: Using 'return' or 'yield' outside a function causes a 'SyntaxError' at runtime.

properties.description: Using 'return' or 'yield' outside a function causes a 'SyntaxError' at runtime.
properties.name: Use of 'return' or 'yield' outside a function

fullDescription.text: Using a 'try-finally' block to ensure only that a resource is closed makes code more difficult to read.

properties.description:
Using a 'try-finally' block to ensure only that a resource is closed makes code more
              difficult to read.
properties.name: Should use a 'with' statement

shortDescription.text: An assert statement has a side-effect

fullDescription.text: Side-effects in assert statements result in differences between normal and optimized behavior.

properties.description:
Side-effects in assert statements result in differences between normal
              and optimized behavior.
properties.name: An assert statement has a side-effect

fullDescription.text: A statement has no effect

properties.description: A statement has no effect
properties.name: Statement has no effect

shortDescription.text: Use of a print statement at module level

fullDescription.text: Using a print statement at module scope (except when guarded by `if __name__ == '__main__'`) will cause surprising output when the module is imported.

properties.description: Using a print statement at module scope (except when guarded by `if __name__ == '__main__'`) will cause surprising output when the module is imported.
properties.name: Use of a print statement at module level

fullDescription.text: Using a 'delete' statement to delete a local variable is unnecessary, because the variable is deleted automatically when the function exits.

properties.description:
Using a 'delete' statement to delete a local variable is
              unnecessary, because the variable is deleted automatically when
              the function exits.
properties.name: Unnecessary delete statement in function

fullDescription.text: An 'else' clause in a 'for' or 'while' statement that does not contain a 'break' is redundant.

properties.description: An 'else' clause in a 'for' or 'while' statement that does not contain a 'break' is redundant.
properties.name: Unnecessary 'else' clause in loop

fullDescription.text: Unnecessary 'pass' statement

properties.description: Unnecessary 'pass' statement
properties.name: Unnecessary pass

fullDescription.text: Code is unreachable

properties.description: Code is unreachable
properties.name: Unreachable code

fullDescription.text: An exception object is created, but is not used.

properties.description: An exception object is created, but is not used.
properties.name: Unused exception object

fullDescription.text: exit() or quit() may fail if the interpreter is run with the -S option.

properties.description: exit() or quit() may fail if the interpreter is run with the -S option.
properties.name: Use of exit() or quit()

fullDescription.text: Using 'assertTrue' or 'assertFalse' rather than a more specific assertion can give uninformative failure messages.

properties.description: Using 'assertTrue' or 'assertFalse' rather than a more specific assertion can give uninformative failure messages.
properties.name: Imprecise assert

fullDescription.text: Use of the 'global' statement at module level

properties.description: Use of the 'global' statement at module level
properties.name: Use of 'global' at module level

shortDescription.text: List comprehension variable used in enclosing scope

fullDescription.text: Using the iteration variable of a list comprehension in the enclosing scope will result in different behavior between Python 2 and 3 and is confusing.

properties.description: Using the iteration variable of a list comprehension in the enclosing scope will result in different behavior between Python 2 and 3 and is confusing.
properties.name: List comprehension variable used in enclosing scope

fullDescription.text: Capturing a loop variable is not the same as capturing its value, and can lead to unexpected behavior or bugs.

properties.description: Capturing a loop variable is not the same as capturing its value, and can lead to unexpected behavior or bugs.
properties.name: Loop variable capture

fullDescription.text: Assignment to a variable occurs multiple times without any intermediate use of that variable

properties.description: Assignment to a variable occurs multiple times without any intermediate use of that variable
properties.name: Variable defined multiple times

fullDescription.text: A loop iteration variable is unused, which suggests an error.

properties.description: A loop iteration variable is unused, which suggests an error.
properties.name: Suspicious unused loop iteration variable

fullDescription.text: Including an undefined attribute in `__all__` causes an exception when the module is imported using '*'

properties.description:
Including an undefined attribute in `__all__` causes an exception when
              the module is imported using '*'
properties.name: Explicit export is not defined
